note.p: American lawyer and philanthropist. AB, Pennsylvania, 1852; MA, 1855; studied in Heidelberg, returning to the US in 1857. Major in the Union army in the American Civil War; on the staff of General Reynolds at the battle of Gettysburg. After the war, practised law in Philadelphia. Member of the American Philosophical Society, 1891.
Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society 60 (1921): iii–ix.
